alert.note: Alert for Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 04 at 7:15PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Suwannee County through 745 PM EDT... At 715 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mcalpin, or 8 miles northeast of Mayo, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Obrien, Mcalpin, Luraville and Newburn. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
